trans-unit.source: Two-Class Neural Network
trans-unit.target: Two-Class Neural Network

trans-unit.source: Creates a binary classifier using a neural network algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a binary classifier using a neural network algorithm

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Neural Network</ui> module to create a neural network model that can be used to predict a target that has only two values.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Neural Network</ui> module to create a neural network model that can be used to predict a target that has only two values.

trans-unit.source: For example, neural networks could be used for predictions in medical scenarios, such as determining whether a patient has a certain disease.
trans-unit.target: For example, neural networks could be used for predictions in medical scenarios, such as determining whether a patient has a certain disease.

trans-unit.source: Classification using neural networks is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.
trans-unit.target: Classification using neural networks is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.

trans-unit.source: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Neural Networks
trans-unit.target: Understanding Neural Networks

trans-unit.source: A neural network is a set of interconnected layers, in which the inputs lead to outputs by a series of weighted edges and nodes.
trans-unit.target: A neural network is a set of interconnected layers, in which the inputs lead to outputs by a series of weighted edges and nodes.

trans-unit.source: The weights on the edges are learned when training the neural network on the input data.
trans-unit.target: The weights on the edges are learned when training the neural network on the input data.

trans-unit.source: The direction of the graph proceeds from the inputs through the hidden layer, with all nodes of the graph connected by the weighted edges to nodes in the next layer.
trans-unit.target: The direction of the graph proceeds from the inputs through the hidden layer, with all nodes of the graph connected by the weighted edges to nodes in the next layer.

trans-unit.source: Most predictive tasks can be accomplished easily with only one or a few hidden layers.
trans-unit.target: Most predictive tasks can be accomplished easily with only one or a few hidden layers.

trans-unit.source: Recent research has shown that deep neural networks (DNN) can be very effective in complex tasks such as image or speech recognition, in which successive layers are used to model increasing levels of semantic depth.
trans-unit.target: Recent research has shown that deep neural networks (DNN) can be very effective in complex tasks such as image or speech recognition, in which successive layers are used to model increasing levels of semantic depth.

trans-unit.source: To compute the output of the network for any given input, a value is calculated for each node in the hidden layers and in the output layer.
trans-unit.target: To compute the output of the network for any given input, a value is calculated for each node in the hidden layers and in the output layer.

trans-unit.source: For each node, the value is set by calculating the weighted sum of the values of the nodes in the previous layer and applying an activation function to that weighted sum.
trans-unit.target: For each node, the value is set by calculating the weighted sum of the values of the nodes in the previous layer and applying an activation function to that weighted sum.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Neural Network Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Neural Network Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the neural network, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the neural network, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: During training, all combinations of the settings you provided will be tested to determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: During training, all combinations of the settings you provided will be tested to determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: You can further customize the neural network model in two ways:
trans-unit.target: You can further customize the neural network model in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Accept the default neural network architecture, and use the <ui>Properties</ui> pane to set other parameters that control the behavior of the neural network, such as learning rate and normalization.
trans-unit.target: Accept the default neural network architecture, and use the <ui>Properties</ui> pane to set other parameters that control the behavior of the neural network, such as learning rate and normalization.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section.

trans-unit.source: If you want to fully customize the network architecture and its connections, use the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_NetSharp" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Net# language</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to fully customize the network architecture and its connections, use the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_NetSharp" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Net# language</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Connect a tagged dataset and train the model.
trans-unit.target: Connect a tagged dataset and train the model.

trans-unit.source: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, train the model by using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, train the model by using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> and a tagged dataset.
trans-unit.target: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> and a tagged dataset.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the trained model, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can then use the trained model, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can use these options to modify the behavior of the neural network.
trans-unit.target: You can use these options to modify the behavior of the neural network.

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Hidden layer specification
trans-unit.target: Hidden layer specification

trans-unit.source: Select the type of network architecture to create.
trans-unit.target: Select the type of network architecture to create.

trans-unit.source: Fully-connected case
trans-unit.target: Fully-connected case

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to use the default neural network architecture.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to use the default neural network architecture.

trans-unit.source: The default two-class neural network model is defined as follows:
trans-unit.target: The default two-class neural network model is defined as follows:

trans-unit.source: The default structure has one hidden layer.
trans-unit.target: The default structure has one hidden layer.

trans-unit.source: The output layer is fully connected to the hidden layer, and the hidden layer is fully connected to the input layer.
trans-unit.target: The output layer is fully connected to the hidden layer, and the hidden layer is fully connected to the input layer.

trans-unit.source: The number of nodes in the input layer is determined by the number of features in the training data.
trans-unit.target: The number of nodes in the input layer is determined by the number of features in the training data.

trans-unit.source: The number of nodes in the hidden layer is determined by the user (with a default value of 100).
trans-unit.target: The number of nodes in the hidden layer is determined by the user (with a default value of 100).

trans-unit.source: The number of nodes in the output layer depends on the number of classes.
trans-unit.target: The number of nodes in the output layer depends on the number of classes.

trans-unit.source: Custom definition script
trans-unit.target: Custom definition script

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to use the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_NetSharp" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Net# language</legacyLink> to create a custom neural network architecture.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to use the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_NetSharp" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Net# language</legacyLink> to create a custom neural network architecture.

trans-unit.source: Neural network definition
trans-unit.target: Neural network definition

trans-unit.source: Type or paste Net# statements in the text box to customize the architecture of the neural network, including the number of hidden layers, their connections, and advanced options such as specifying the mappings between layers.
trans-unit.target: Type or paste Net# statements in the text box to customize the architecture of the neural network, including the number of hidden layers, their connections, and advanced options such as specifying the mappings between layers.

trans-unit.source: This option is available only if you select the <ui>Custom definition script</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: This option is available only if you select the <ui>Custom definition script</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: For script examples, see <externalLink><linkText>Guide to the Net# Neural Networks Specification Language</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=402867</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For script examples, see <externalLink><linkText>Guide to the Net# Neural Networks Specification Language</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=402867</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Number of hidden nodes
trans-unit.target: Number of hidden nodes

trans-unit.source: Type the number of hidden nodes.
trans-unit.target: Type the number of hidden nodes.

trans-unit.source: By default, there is one hidden layer with 100 nodes.
trans-unit.target: By default, there is one hidden layer with 100 nodes.

trans-unit.source: Learning rate
trans-unit.target: Learning rate

trans-unit.source: Type a value that defines the step taken at each iteration, before correction.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that defines the step taken at each iteration, before correction.

trans-unit.source: A larger value for learning rate can cause the model to converge faster, but it can overshoot local minima.
trans-unit.target: A larger value for learning rate can cause the model to converge faster, but it can overshoot local minima.

trans-unit.source: Number of learning iterations
trans-unit.target: Number of learning iterations

trans-unit.source: Specify the maximum number of times the algorithm processes the training cases.
trans-unit.target: Specify the maximum number of times the algorithm processes the training cases.

trans-unit.source: The initial learning weights diameter
trans-unit.target: The initial learning weights diameter

trans-unit.source: Specify the node weights at the start of the learning process.
trans-unit.target: Specify the node weights at the start of the learning process.

trans-unit.source: The momentum
trans-unit.target: The momentum

trans-unit.source: Specify a weight to apply during learning to nodes from previous iterations
trans-unit.target: Specify a weight to apply during learning to nodes from previous iterations

trans-unit.source: The type of normalizer
trans-unit.target: The type of normalizer

trans-unit.source: Choose the method that is used for feature normalization, or use no normalization.
trans-unit.target: Choose the method that is used for feature normalization, or use no normalization.

trans-unit.source: The following normalization methods are supported:
trans-unit.target: The following normalization methods are supported:

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Binning normalizer</ui></legacyItalic>: The binning normalizer creates bins of equal size, and then normalizes every value in each bin to be divided by the total number of bins.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Binning normalizer</ui></legacyItalic>: The binning normalizer creates bins of equal size, and then normalizes every value in each bin to be divided by the total number of bins.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Gaussian normalizer</ui></legacyItalic>: The Gaussian normalizer rescales the values of each feature to have mean 0 and variance 1.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Gaussian normalizer</ui></legacyItalic>: The Gaussian normalizer rescales the values of each feature to have mean 0 and variance 1.

trans-unit.source: This is done by computing the mean and the variance of each feature, and then, for each instance, subtracting the mean value and dividing by the square root of the variance (the standard deviation).
trans-unit.target: This is done by computing the mean and the variance of each feature, and then, for each instance, subtracting the mean value and dividing by the square root of the variance (the standard deviation).

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Min-max normalizer</ui></legacyItalic>: The min-max normalizer linearly rescales every feature to the [0,1] interval.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Min-max normalizer</ui></legacyItalic>: The min-max normalizer linearly rescales every feature to the [0,1] interval.

trans-unit.source: Rescaling to the [0,1] interval is done by shifting the values of each feature so that the minimal value is 0, and then dividing by the new maximal value (which is the difference between the original maximal and minimal values).
trans-unit.target: Rescaling to the [0,1] interval is done by shifting the values of each feature so that the minimal value is 0, and then dividing by the new maximal value (which is the difference between the original maximal and minimal values).

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Do not normalize</ui></legacyItalic>: No normalization is performed.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Do not normalize</ui></legacyItalic>: No normalization is performed.

trans-unit.source: Shuffle examples
trans-unit.target: Shuffle examples

trans-unit.source: Select this option to shuffle cases between iterations.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to shuffle cases between iterations.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect this option, cases are processed in exactly the same order each time you run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect this option, cases are processed in exactly the same order each time you run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Random number seed
trans-unit.target: Random number seed

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use as the seed.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use as the seed.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a seed value is useful when you want to ensure repeatability across runs of the same experiment.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a seed value is useful when you want to ensure repeatability across runs of the same experiment.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown categorical levels
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values in the training and validation sets.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values in the training and validation sets.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Customizing a Neural Network Using Net#
trans-unit.target: Customizing a Neural Network Using Net#

trans-unit.source: In Azure Machine Learning, you can customize the architecture of the neural network model by using Net#.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Machine Learning, you can customize the architecture of the neural network model by using Net#.

trans-unit.source: The customizations include:
trans-unit.target: The customizations include:

trans-unit.source: Creating hidden layers and controlling the number of nodes in each layer
trans-unit.target: Creating hidden layers and controlling the number of nodes in each layer

trans-unit.source: Specifying how layers are to be connected to each other
trans-unit.target: Specifying how layers are to be connected to each other

trans-unit.source: Defining special connectivity structures, such as convolutions and weight-sharing bundles
trans-unit.target: Defining special connectivity structures, such as convolutions and weight-sharing bundles

trans-unit.source: Specifying activation functions
trans-unit.target: Specifying activation functions

trans-unit.source: A neural network model is defined by the structure of its graph, which includes these attributes:
trans-unit.target: A neural network model is defined by the structure of its graph, which includes these attributes:

trans-unit.source: Number of hidden layers
trans-unit.target: Number of hidden layers

trans-unit.source: Number of nodes in each hidden layer
trans-unit.target: Number of nodes in each hidden layer

trans-unit.source: Connections between the layers
trans-unit.target: Connections between the layers

trans-unit.source: Choice of activation functions
trans-unit.target: Choice of activation functions

trans-unit.source: Weights on the graph edges
trans-unit.target: Weights on the graph edges

trans-unit.source: The structure of the graph and the activation function are determined by the user.
trans-unit.target: The structure of the graph and the activation function are determined by the user.

trans-unit.source: The weights on the edges are learned when training the neural network on the input data.
trans-unit.target: The weights on the edges are learned when training the neural network on the input data.

trans-unit.source: The first layer is always the input layer.
trans-unit.target: The first layer is always the input layer.

trans-unit.source: The last layer is always the output layer.
trans-unit.target: The last layer is always the output layer.

trans-unit.source: The number of nodes in the output layer should be equal to the number of classes.
trans-unit.target: The number of nodes in the output layer should be equal to the number of classes.

trans-unit.source: You can define any number of intermediate layers (sometimes called hidden layers, because they are contained within the model, and they are not directly exposed as endpoints).
trans-unit.target: You can define any number of intermediate layers (sometimes called hidden layers, because they are contained within the model, and they are not directly exposed as endpoints).

trans-unit.source: The Net# reference guide explains the syntax and provides sample network definitions.
trans-unit.target: The Net# reference guide explains the syntax and provides sample network definitions.

trans-unit.source: It explains how you can use Net# to add hidden layers and define the way that the different layers interact with each other.
trans-unit.target: It explains how you can use Net# to add hidden layers and define the way that the different layers interact with each other.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see: <externalLink><linkText>Guide to the Net# Neural Networks Specification Language</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=402867</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see: <externalLink><linkText>Guide to the Net# Neural Networks Specification Language</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=402867</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The experiments are related and described in a single document that progresses from basic to advanced configurations:
trans-unit.target: The experiments are related and described in a single document that progresses from basic to advanced configurations:

trans-unit.source: Deep Neural networks sample (part A)
trans-unit.target: Deep Neural networks sample (part A)

trans-unit.source: Deep Neural networks sample (part B)
trans-unit.target: Deep Neural networks sample (part B)

trans-unit.target: Deep Neural networks sample (part C)

trans-unit.source: Deep Neural networks sample (part D)
trans-unit.target: Deep Neural networks sample (part D)

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: A neural network can be thought of as a weighted and directed acyclic graph.
trans-unit.target: A neural network can be thought of as a weighted and directed acyclic graph.

trans-unit.source: The nodes of the graph are arranged in layers, and they are connected by weighted edges to nodes in the next layer.
trans-unit.target: The nodes of the graph are arranged in layers, and they are connected by weighted edges to nodes in the next layer.

trans-unit.source: To compute the output of the network given a certain input, a value is calculated for each node in the hidden layers and in the output layer.
trans-unit.target: To compute the output of the network given a certain input, a value is calculated for each node in the hidden layers and in the output layer.

trans-unit.source: For each node, the value is set by calculating the weighted sum of the values of the nodes in the previous layer and applying an activation function to that weighted sum.
trans-unit.target: For each node, the value is set by calculating the weighted sum of the values of the nodes in the previous layer and applying an activation function to that weighted sum.

trans-unit.source: Neural networks are notoriously hard to train due to a number of hyperparameters (such as learning rate, momentum, and network topology).
trans-unit.target: Neural networks are notoriously hard to train due to a number of hyperparameters (such as learning rate, momentum, and network topology).

trans-unit.source: Although in many cases neural networks produce better results than other algorithms, obtaining such results may involve fair amount of sweeping (iterations) over hyperparameters.
trans-unit.target: Although in many cases neural networks produce better results than other algorithms, obtaining such results may involve fair amount of sweeping (iterations) over hyperparameters.

trans-unit.target: Hidden layer specification

trans-unit.target: Neural Network Topology

trans-unit.target: Specify the architecture of the hidden layer or layers

trans-unit.target: The initial learning weights diameter

trans-unit.target: Specify the size of each step in the learning process

trans-unit.source: The momentum
trans-unit.target: The momentum

trans-unit.source: Float
